result.markdown:
--- title: Attachments --- Ibis Birdbrain passes Python objects as `Attachments` to [`Messages`](./messages.qmd). This allows the user, itself, and (eventually) other bots to interact with data, code, and more. ## Usage ::: {#77a9f256 .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} from ibis_birdbrain.attachments import Attachment, Attachments a1 = Attachment(content="Hello, world!") a1 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=1} ``` Attachment **guid**: aefa7dd8-1504-466e-afa8-fa0053ef087e **time**: 2024-03-05 11:22:38.343515 **name**: None **desc**: None ``` ::: ::: ## TableAttachment A `TableAttachment` contains an Ibis table: ::: {#9a87d9f6 .cell execution_count=2} ``` {.python .cell-code} import ibis from ibis_birdbrain.attachments import TableAttachment ibis.options.interactive = True t = ibis.examples.penguins.fetch() a2 = TableAttachment(content=t) a2 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` INFO:pins.cache:cache file: /Users/cody/Library/Caches/pins-py/gcs_332a30997e141da0e08f15fbfae8b3c3ec90463922d117a96fa3b1bef85a2a4c/penguins/20230905T090411Z-9aae2/data.txt INFO:pins.cache:cache file: /Users/cody/Library/Caches/pins-py/gcs_332a30997e141da0e08f15fbfae8b3c3ec90463922d117a96fa3b1bef85a2a4c/penguins/20230905T090411Z-9aae2/penguins.csv.gz ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html} 

```
:::

Notice the name, description (schema), and preview are automatically populated.

## CodeAttachment

A `CodeAttachment` contains code -- typically Python or SQL:

::: {#89ecfbf6 .cell execution_count=3}
``` {.python .cell-code}
from ibis_birdbrain.attachments import CodeAttachment

a3 = CodeAttachment(content="select 1 as id", language="sql")
a3
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=3}
```
CodeAttachment
    **guid**: 8138742b-dcef-4735-b452-8481468e12da
    **time**: 2024-03-05 11:22:40.087917
    **name**: None
    **desc**: None
    **language**: sql
    **code**:
select 1 as id
```
:::
